title: Complementary Serif Typeface for InStyle Magazine
content:
Been trying to figure out what this typeface is:

[http://img2.timeinc.net/instyle/static/2007/i/shopping/hd\_shopping.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115181054/http:/img2.timeinc.net/instyle/static/2007/i/shopping/hd_shopping.gif "http://img2.timeinc.net/instyle/static/2007/i/shopping/hd\_shopping.gif")  
 [http://img2.timeinc.net/instyle/static/2007/i/pkg/summerfashion2009/hd\_p...](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115181054/http:/img2.timeinc.net/instyle/static/2007/i/pkg/summerfashion2009/hd_packagename.gif "http://img2.timeinc.net/instyle/static/2007/i/pkg/summerfashion2009/hd\_packagename.gif")

My suspicion is that it's a custom cut (Caslon and Bodoni combination).

The following letters are clearly Bodoni: e,g,

Combined glyphs: b,t,i, p

Thoughts?
author: megax

comments.content: I think you may have nailed it. Cheers!
